Business Information: Since 1996, our firm has served as a fierce advocate for the rights and interests of our clients. Due to our experience, skill and record of success, our peers recognize the legal team at Marsh, Rickard & Bryan as a force in and out of the courtroom.

At Roderick Walls & Associates, LLC our attorneys and staff understand and appreciate that with each client comes a unique set of circumstances and needs. Matt Abbott with the Abbott Law Firm proudly represents the legal needs of those with with personal injury and wrongful death claims. From his law office in Birmingham, Alabama, Abbott focuses on the areas of tractor-trailer and automobile collisions, defective product liability and medical/pharmaceutical negligence. Abbott serves clients who need representation for worker's compensation as well as those who have fallen victim to consumer fraud and insurance bad faith. Abbott strives to protect those who are the victim of civil rights violations and wrongful government indictment. Abbott also represents "whistle-blowers" who come forward to expose fraud and corruption against the United States government through the False Claims Act.

At Simms & Associates, we have defended those accused of a crime and advocated for those who have suffered a personal injury or wrongful death of a loved one. In all of our cases, we provide attentive service to our clients and allow them to benefit from our experience. Legal experience is matched by a unique background in the auto insurance industry. Point-of-view has benefited many clients in the past and can benefit you. Criminal charges can impact every aspect of your life. Your right to drive a vehicle, where and with whom you may live, the cost of insurance, and of course your freedom, can be affected by a criminal conviction. A severe and preventable injury can cause physical and emotional pain that prevents you from enjoying life and working as you did before the accident. 
 
At the law firm of Simms & Associates in Birmingham, we understand that you need diligent and experienced representation from an experienced trial attorney to ensure that your rights are protected. We believe you deserve the best possible outcome, and we dedicate all of our resources to that important goal.

Almost fifty years ago, when specialization was not the trend, Ted Taylor dedicated his practice to relentlessly pursuing a brighter horizon for those individuals and businesses who have been wronged and whose fortunes and future seem bleak. Taylor & Taylor continues its singular focus on representing plaintiffs in cases throughout the southeastern United States.  The firm approaches each case to obtain the greatest result for each client in an aggressive and expeditious manner.  Taylor & Taylor has a winning history of trying lawsuits and recovering for clients in all types of litigation. A full service plaintiff’s trial and appellate practice law firm, Taylor & Taylor is prepared to carry each case from the point of incident to conclusion, through the entire appeals process when necessary. The firm’s practice extends to all corners of the state and beyond, and its lawyers have superior trial experience at all court levels.  Taylor & Taylor specializes in trucking litigation, motor vehicle accidents, products liability, insurance bad faith, bank and insurance fraud, wrongful death, personal injury, nursing home abuse and neglect and spinal cord injury cases. Whether settling out of court, trying cases before juries or handling appeals at the highest level, Taylor & Taylor is equipped to manage your case at every stage of the litigation process. Clients benefit from the firm's responsiveness, personal focus, and award-winning attorneys.

Business Name: Law Offices of F Inge Johnstone
Business Information: The Law Offices of F. Inge Johnstone is a plaintiff's firm in Birmingham Alabama concentrating in personal injury and fraud affecting individuals and small businesses.

When you have been injured, arrested or you are facing a family crisis you need a lawyer with experience who will answer your questions, explain your rights and be willing and able to protect you, your family and your rights. I understand that when you are facing a legal crisis it is often a traumatic experience and most people dont know what to do or who to call for advice. That is why I dont charge for an initial consultation on any legal matter. Even if you have a legal problem that I dont handle I can refer you to a lawyer who I know has experience handling that specific area of law. Call us today.

Business Name: Buck Frank S PC Attorney At Law
Business Information: Frank S. Buck is Birmingham's personal injury attorney. He has practiced law in the Birmingham area for over 40 years. He has dedicated himself to helping people in times of need, concentrating in plaintiff personal injury law as a way to do that. Whether the injury happened in the workplace, as a result of defective products or medical malpractice, a wrong prescription, or other negligence, people need help to get redress. Regardless of where your or your loved one's injury occurred, Frank Buck or one of his skilled attorneys will help you receive the compensation you deserve. Let us provide you with fair and honest legal representation. Visit our other pages to learn more about our legal services.

Ifediba Law Group, LLC specializes in offering legal representation to injured individuals and families. Located in Birmingham, Ala., it is a full-service law firm. Ifediba Law Group, LLC represents individuals injured in motor vehicle accidents, medical malpractice, defective drugs, slip and fall or faulty products. Additionally, its areas of practice include wrongful deaths, nursing home litigation, dog bites, construction law, pesticide exposure, toxic torts litigation, traumatic brain injury, insurance bad faith, airplane accidents, and more.

When you trust your case to a law firm, you should know exactly who will represent you. 
 
You need to trust that team to get you the very best results possible—no matter how simple or complex your case. 
 
We're proud of what we do to earn justice for our clients every single day—combining expertise, experience, and the willingness to fight for what's right. 
 
Find out more about DLG For Me today.

The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

Our Personal Injury firm has been serving the Gulf Coast states of Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama and Arkansas for 30+ years. Injured in an accident? One Call, That's All! 
Our decades of experience mean that we can help you get financial compensation and protect your rights as a victim. Some of our settlements have even exceeded $1 million for clients just like you.

Alabama Personal Injury LawyerOur goal at Morris Haynes is to represent the victims of wrongdoing and injury in their claims against the powerful corporations of the world, with an absolute commitment to the highest principles of professionalism and advocacy. Were dedicated to serving you however we can, and doing whats best for you in your personal injury case.If you or someone you love has been injured as the result of the negligence of someone else, you may be entitled to compensation. Call Morris Haynes. Common causes of personal injury lawsuits are: Car AccidentsCar accidents are extremely common, and anything from a fender bender to a serious highway accident can cause personal injury. Even without medical expenses, these kinds of accidents can lead to serious vehicle damage and repair costs. If you were harmed in a car accident due to the negligence of someone else, you deserve to be compensated for your injuries. The attorneys at Morris Haynes have extensive experience in these kinds of cases, and will do whatever we can to help you.Truck AccidentsIts easy for an accident involving an 18-wheeler to get complicatedand fast. When a truck is owned by a company, there are a lot of legal questions that need answering if you want to get the compensation you deserve. Luckily, our attorneys are no strangers to these kinds of accidents. Well help you gather, and sort through, all the evidence you need to make a successful case and maximize your recovery.Motorcycle AccidentsAccording to the U.S. Department of Transportation motorcyclists are 35 times more likely to experience a deadly accident on the road than those in passenger cars. Due to the weight difference between motorcycles and other vehicles, these accidents almost always result in injuries with extensive medical bills.Boating Accidents2019 was the deadliest year on Alabama waters since 1998, with 25 boating deaths. That number surpasses year-end totals for the last 20 years. Boating accidents are a serious threat to the safety and wellbeing of Alabamas residents, and you need expert legal help to recover what you deserve. The primary cause of boating accidents is operator error.Product LiabilityWhen a product doesnt work the way its meant to, especially if it causes harm to those who put their trust in it, someone needs to be held responsible. Our track record regarding product defect cases has earned our firm the respect of many opposing attorneys and a reputation for providing excellent representation. We have over 30 years of experience as a law firm helping clients receive compensation from some of the most powerful corporations in the country. If you or a loved one have been injured as a result of a defective product contact us.Gun DefectsMost people expect their guns to protect them, or at least to allow them to participate in a hobby they love. When a gun is defective, it can lead to very serious injuries and even death. Gun manufacturers have a responsibility to check each and every brand, make, and model they produce for quality assurance. When they slip up, it has serious consequences. If youve been harmed, or a loved one was killed, by a defective gun, the attorneys at Morris Haynes are ready to fight for you.Slip and Fall AccidentsSlip and fall accidents can result in serious injuries. All property owners are expected to keep their properties clean and safe for the people who use them. When they dont, personal injuries are bound to happen. Whether you or a loved one tripped over something left in a pathway, or slipped on a slick floor with no warning, well fight to get you the compensation you deserve.

The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

Injuries from semi-truck, motorcycle, and car accidents change lives. But at the 40% fee most lawyers charge, it can be difficult to keep up with medical bills or make up for lost wages. Without the attention you need, you may end up shelling out tremendous sums of money to cover medical bills for injuries that weren’t your fault. 
 
At Low Cost Lawyer, many of our clients become friends for life. We invest enormous effort and care in seeking justice for those we represent, forming bonds in the process. Our team of legal professionals and investigators get to work on your case the moment you call—a degree of attention you can’t always count on nationwide or regional firms.

Alabama Personal Injury LawyerOur goal at Morris Haynes is to represent the victims of wrongdoing and injury in their claims against the powerful corporations of the world, with an absolute commitment to the highest principles of professionalism and advocacy. Were dedicated to serving you however we can, and doing whats best for you in your personal injury case.If you or someone you love has been injured as the result of the negligence of someone else, you may be entitled to compensation. Call Morris Haynes. Common causes of personal injury lawsuits are: Car AccidentsCar accidents are extremely common, and anything from a fender bender to a serious highway accident can cause personal injury. Even without medical expenses, these kinds of accidents can lead to serious vehicle damage and repair costs. If you were harmed in a car accident due to the negligence of someone else, you deserve to be compensated for your injuries. The attorneys at Morris Haynes have extensive experience in these kinds of cases, and will do whatever we can to help you.Truck AccidentsIts easy for an accident involving an 18-wheeler to get complicatedand fast. When a truck is owned by a company, there are a lot of legal questions that need answering if you want to get the compensation you deserve. Luckily, our attorneys are no strangers to these kinds of accidents. Well help you gather, and sort through, all the evidence you need to make a successful case and maximize your recovery.Motorcycle AccidentsAccording to the U.S. Department of Transportation motorcyclists are 35 times more likely to experience a deadly accident on the road than those in passenger cars. Due to the weight difference between motorcycles and other vehicles, these accidents almost always result in injuries with extensive medical bills.Boating Accidents2019 was the deadliest year on Alabama waters since 1998, with 25 boating deaths. That number surpasses year-end totals for the last 20 years. Boating accidents are a serious threat to the safety and wellbeing of Alabamas residents, and you need expert legal help to recover what you deserve. The primary cause of boating accidents is operator error.Product LiabilityWhen a product doesnt work the way its meant to, especially if it causes harm to those who put their trust in it, someone needs to be held responsible. Our track record regarding product defect cases has earned our firm the respect of many opposing attorneys and a reputation for providing excellent representation. We have over 30 years of experience as a law firm helping clients receive compensation from some of the most powerful corporations in the country. If you or a loved one have been injured as a result of a defective product contact us.Gun DefectsMost people expect their guns to protect them, or at least to allow them to participate in a hobby they love. When a gun is defective, it can lead to very serious injuries and even death. Gun manufacturers have a responsibility to check each and every brand, make, and model they produce for quality assurance. When they slip up, it has serious consequences. If youve been harmed, or a loved one was killed, by a defective gun, the attorneys at Morris Haynes are ready to fight for you.Slip and Fall AccidentsSlip and fall accidents can result in serious injuries. All property owners are expected to keep their properties clean and safe for the people who use them. When they dont, personal injuries are bound to happen. Whether you or a loved one tripped over something left in a pathway, or slipped on a slick floor with no warning, well fight to get you the compensation you deserve.

Almost fifty years ago, when specialization was not the trend, Ted Taylor dedicated his practice to relentlessly pursuing a brighter horizon for those individuals and businesses who have been wronged and whose fortunes and future seem bleak. The firm approaches each case to obtain the greatest result for each client in an aggressive and expeditious manner.  Taylor & Taylor has a winning history of trying lawsuits and recovering for clients in all types of litigation. A full service plaintiff’s trial and appellate practice law firm, Taylor & Taylor is prepared to carry each case from the point of incident to conclusion, through the entire appeals process when necessary. Taylor & Taylor specializes in trucking litigation, motor vehicle accidents, products liability, insurance bad faith, bank and insurance fraud, wrongful death, personal injury, nursing home abuse and neglect and spinal cord injury cases. Clients benefit from the firm's responsiveness, personal focus, and award-winning attorneys.

The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

At Low Cost Lawyer, many of our clients become friends for life. We invest enormous effort and care in seeking justice for those we represent, forming bonds in the process. Alabama Personal Injury LawyerOur goal at Morris Haynes is to represent the victims of wrongdoing and injury in their claims against the powerful corporations of the world, with an absolute commitment to the highest principles of professionalism and advocacy. Were dedicated to serving you however we can, and doing whats best for you in your personal injury case.If you or someone you love has been injured as the result of the negligence of someone else, you may be entitled to compensation. Call Morris Haynes. Common causes of personal injury lawsuits are: Car AccidentsCar accidents are extremely common, and anything from a fender bender to a serious highway accident can cause personal injury. Even without medical expenses, these kinds of accidents can lead to serious vehicle damage and repair costs. If you were harmed in a car accident due to the negligence of someone else, you deserve to be compensated for your injuries. The attorneys at Morris Haynes have extensive experience in these kinds of cases, and will do whatever we can to help you.Truck AccidentsIts easy for an accident involving an 18-wheeler to get complicatedand fast. When a truck is owned by a company, there are a lot of legal questions that need answering if you want to get the compensation you deserve. Luckily, our attorneys are no strangers to these kinds of accidents. Well help you gather, and sort through, all the evidence you need to make a successful case and maximize your recovery.Motorcycle AccidentsAccording to the U.S. Department of Transportation motorcyclists are 35 times more likely to experience a deadly accident on the road than those in passenger cars. Due to the weight difference between motorcycles and other vehicles, these accidents almost always result in injuries with extensive medical bills.Boating Accidents2019 was the deadliest year on Alabama waters since 1998, with 25 boating deaths. That number surpasses year-end totals for the last 20 years. Boating accidents are a serious threat to the safety and wellbeing of Alabamas residents, and you need expert legal help to recover what you deserve. The primary cause of boating accidents is operator error.Product LiabilityWhen a product doesnt work the way its meant to, especially if it causes harm to those who put their trust in it, someone needs to be held responsible. Our track record regarding product defect cases has earned our firm the respect of many opposing attorneys and a reputation for providing excellent representation. We have over 30 years of experience as a law firm helping clients receive compensation from some of the most powerful corporations in the country. If you or a loved one have been injured as a result of a defective product contact us.Gun DefectsMost people expect their guns to protect them, or at least to allow them to participate in a hobby they love. When a gun is defective, it can lead to very serious injuries and even death. Gun manufacturers have a responsibility to check each and every brand, make, and model they produce for quality assurance. When they slip up, it has serious consequences. If youve been harmed, or a loved one was killed, by a defective gun, the attorneys at Morris Haynes are ready to fight for you.Slip and Fall AccidentsSlip and fall accidents can result in serious injuries. All property owners are expected to keep their properties clean and safe for the people who use them. When they dont, personal injuries are bound to happen. Whether you or a loved one tripped over something left in a pathway, or slipped on a slick floor with no warning, well fight to get you the compensation you deserve.

We're proud of what we do to earn justice for our clients every single day—combining expertise, experience, and the willingness to fight for what's right. 
 
Find out more about DLG For Me today.

The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

Injuries from semi-truck, motorcycle, and car accidents change lives. But at the 40% fee most lawyers charge, it can be difficult to keep up with medical bills or make up for lost wages. Without the attention you need, you may end up shelling out tremendous sums of money to cover medical bills for injuries that weren’t your fault. 
 
At Low Cost Lawyer, many of our clients become friends for life. We invest enormous effort and care in seeking justice for those we represent, forming bonds in the process. Our team of legal professionals and investigators get to work on your case the moment you call—a degree of attention you can’t always count on nationwide or regional firms.

Alabama Personal Injury LawyerOur goal at Morris Haynes is to represent the victims of wrongdoing and injury in their claims against the powerful corporations of the world, with an absolute commitment to the highest principles of professionalism and advocacy. Were dedicated to serving you however we can, and doing whats best for you in your personal injury case.If you or someone you love has been injured as the result of the negligence of someone else, you may be entitled to compensation. Call Morris Haynes. Common causes of personal injury lawsuits are: Car AccidentsCar accidents are extremely common, and anything from a fender bender to a serious highway accident can cause personal injury. Even without medical expenses, these kinds of accidents can lead to serious vehicle damage and repair costs. If you were harmed in a car accident due to the negligence of someone else, you deserve to be compensated for your injuries. The attorneys at Morris Haynes have extensive experience in these kinds of cases, and will do whatever we can to help you.Truck AccidentsIts easy for an accident involving an 18-wheeler to get complicatedand fast. When a truck is owned by a company, there are a lot of legal questions that need answering if you want to get the compensation you deserve. Luckily, our attorneys are no strangers to these kinds of accidents. Well help you gather, and sort through, all the evidence you need to make a successful case and maximize your recovery.Motorcycle AccidentsAccording to the U.S. Department of Transportation motorcyclists are 35 times more likely to experience a deadly accident on the road than those in passenger cars. Due to the weight difference between motorcycles and other vehicles, these accidents almost always result in injuries with extensive medical bills.Boating Accidents2019 was the deadliest year on Alabama waters since 1998, with 25 boating deaths. That number surpasses year-end totals for the last 20 years. Boating accidents are a serious threat to the safety and wellbeing of Alabamas residents, and you need expert legal help to recover what you deserve. The primary cause of boating accidents is operator error.Product LiabilityWhen a product doesnt work the way its meant to, especially if it causes harm to those who put their trust in it, someone needs to be held responsible. Our track record regarding product defect cases has earned our firm the respect of many opposing attorneys and a reputation for providing excellent representation. We have over 30 years of experience as a law firm helping clients receive compensation from some of the most powerful corporations in the country. If you or a loved one have been injured as a result of a defective product contact us.Gun DefectsMost people expect their guns to protect them, or at least to allow them to participate in a hobby they love. When a gun is defective, it can lead to very serious injuries and even death. Gun manufacturers have a responsibility to check each and every brand, make, and model they produce for quality assurance. When they slip up, it has serious consequences. If youve been harmed, or a loved one was killed, by a defective gun, the attorneys at Morris Haynes are ready to fight for you.Slip and Fall AccidentsSlip and fall accidents can result in serious injuries. All property owners are expected to keep their properties clean and safe for the people who use them. When they dont, personal injuries are bound to happen. Whether you or a loved one tripped over something left in a pathway, or slipped on a slick floor with no warning, well fight to get you the compensation you deserve.

At Simms & Associates, we have defended those accused of a crime and advocated for those who have suffered a personal injury or wrongful death of a loved one. Almost fifty years ago, when specialization was not the trend, Ted Taylor dedicated his practice to relentlessly pursuing a brighter horizon for those individuals and businesses who have been wronged and whose fortunes and future seem bleak. Taylor & Taylor continues its singular focus on representing plaintiffs in cases throughout the southeastern United States.  The firm approaches each case to obtain the greatest result for each client in an aggressive and expeditious manner.  Taylor & Taylor has a winning history of trying lawsuits and recovering for clients in all types of litigation. A full service plaintiff’s trial and appellate practice law firm, Taylor & Taylor is prepared to carry each case from the point of incident to conclusion, through the entire appeals process when necessary. The firm’s practice extends to all corners of the state and beyond, and its lawyers have superior trial experience at all court levels.  Taylor & Taylor specializes in trucking litigation, motor vehicle accidents, products liability, insurance bad faith, bank and insurance fraud, wrongful death, personal injury, nursing home abuse and neglect and spinal cord injury cases. Whether settling out of court, trying cases before juries or handling appeals at the highest level, Taylor & Taylor is equipped to manage your case at every stage of the litigation process. Clients benefit from the firm's responsiveness, personal focus, and award-winning attorneys.

If you were harmed in a car accident due to the negligence of someone else, you deserve to be compensated for your injuries. The attorneys at Morris Haynes have extensive experience in these kinds of cases, and will do whatever we can to help you.Truck AccidentsIts easy for an accident involving an 18-wheeler to get complicatedand fast. When a truck is owned by a company, there are a lot of legal questions that need answering if you want to get the compensation you deserve. Luckily, our attorneys are no strangers to these kinds of accidents. Well help you gather, and sort through, all the evidence you need to make a successful case and maximize your recovery.Motorcycle AccidentsAccording to the U.S. Department of Transportation motorcyclists are 35 times more likely to experience a deadly accident on the road than those in passenger cars. Due to the weight difference between motorcycles and other vehicles, these accidents almost always result in injuries with extensive medical bills.Boating Accidents2019 was the deadliest year on Alabama waters since 1998, with 25 boating deaths. That number surpasses year-end totals for the last 20 years. Boating accidents are a serious threat to the safety and wellbeing of Alabamas residents, and you need expert legal help to recover what you deserve. The primary cause of boating accidents is operator error.Product LiabilityWhen a product doesnt work the way its meant to, especially if it causes harm to those who put their trust in it, someone needs to be held responsible. Our track record regarding product defect cases has earned our firm the respect of many opposing attorneys and a reputation for providing excellent representation. We have over 30 years of experience as a law firm helping clients receive compensation from some of the most powerful corporations in the country. If you or a loved one have been injured as a result of a defective product contact us.Gun DefectsMost people expect their guns to protect them, or at least to allow them to participate in a hobby they love. When a gun is defective, it can lead to very serious injuries and even death. Gun manufacturers have a responsibility to check each and every brand, make, and model they produce for quality assurance. When they slip up, it has serious consequences. If youve been harmed, or a loved one was killed, by a defective gun, the attorneys at Morris Haynes are ready to fight for you.Slip and Fall AccidentsSlip and fall accidents can result in serious injuries. All property owners are expected to keep their properties clean and safe for the people who use them. When they dont, personal injuries are bound to happen. Whether you or a loved one tripped over something left in a pathway, or slipped on a slick floor with no warning, well fight to get you the compensation you deserve.

CR Legal Team is a personal injury law firm with offices, partnerships, and affiliations throughout the United States. Business Name: Porterfield Harper Mills Motlow & Ireland PA
Business Information: Porterfield, Harper, Mills & Motlow is a full-service law firm that provides client services in various practice areas. Matt Abbott with the Abbott Law Firm proudly represents the legal needs of those with with personal injury and wrongful death claims. At Simms & Associates, we have defended those accused of a crime and advocated for those who have suffered a personal injury or wrongful death of a loved one. In all of our cases, we provide attentive service to our clients and allow them to benefit from our experience. Legal experience is matched by a unique background in the auto insurance industry. Point-of-view has benefited many clients in the past and can benefit you. Criminal charges can impact every aspect of your life. Your right to drive a vehicle, where and with whom you may live, the cost of insurance, and of course your freedom, can be affected by a criminal conviction. A severe and preventable injury can cause physical and emotional pain that prevents you from enjoying life and working as you did before the accident. 
 
At the law firm of Simms & Associates in Birmingham, we understand that you need diligent and experienced representation from an experienced trial attorney to ensure that your rights are protected. We believe you deserve the best possible outcome, and we dedicate all of our resources to that important goal.

Almost fifty years ago, when specialization was not the trend, Ted Taylor dedicated his practice to relentlessly pursuing a brighter horizon for those individuals and businesses who have been wronged and whose fortunes and future seem bleak. Taylor & Taylor continues its singular focus on representing plaintiffs in cases throughout the southeastern United States.  The firm approaches each case to obtain the greatest result for each client in an aggressive and expeditious manner.  Taylor & Taylor has a winning history of trying lawsuits and recovering for clients in all types of litigation. A full service plaintiff’s trial and appellate practice law firm, Taylor & Taylor is prepared to carry each case from the point of incident to conclusion, through the entire appeals process when necessary. The firm’s practice extends to all corners of the state and beyond, and its lawyers have superior trial experience at all court levels.  Taylor & Taylor specializes in trucking litigation, motor vehicle accidents, products liability, insurance bad faith, bank and insurance fraud, wrongful death, personal injury, nursing home abuse and neglect and spinal cord injury cases. Whether settling out of court, trying cases before juries or handling appeals at the highest level, Taylor & Taylor is equipped to manage your case at every stage of the litigation process. Clients benefit from the firm's responsiveness, personal focus, and award-winning attorneys.

The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

Almost fifty years ago, when specialization was not the trend, Ted Taylor dedicated his practice to relentlessly pursuing a brighter horizon for those individuals and businesses who have been wronged and whose fortunes and future seem bleak. Taylor & Taylor specializes in trucking litigation, motor vehicle accidents, products liability, insurance bad faith, bank and insurance fraud, wrongful death, personal injury, nursing home abuse and neglect and spinal cord injury cases. The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

Without the attention you need, you may end up shelling out tremendous sums of money to cover medical bills for injuries that weren’t your fault. 
 
At Low Cost Lawyer, many of our clients become friends for life. We invest enormous effort and care in seeking justice for those we represent, forming bonds in the process. Alabama Personal Injury LawyerOur goal at Morris Haynes is to represent the victims of wrongdoing and injury in their claims against the powerful corporations of the world, with an absolute commitment to the highest principles of professionalism and advocacy. Were dedicated to serving you however we can, and doing whats best for you in your personal injury case.If you or someone you love has been injured as the result of the negligence of someone else, you may be entitled to compensation. Call Morris Haynes. Common causes of personal injury lawsuits are: Car AccidentsCar accidents are extremely common, and anything from a fender bender to a serious highway accident can cause personal injury. Even without medical expenses, these kinds of accidents can lead to serious vehicle damage and repair costs. If you were harmed in a car accident due to the negligence of someone else, you deserve to be compensated for your injuries. The attorneys at Morris Haynes have extensive experience in these kinds of cases, and will do whatever we can to help you.Truck AccidentsIts easy for an accident involving an 18-wheeler to get complicatedand fast. When a truck is owned by a company, there are a lot of legal questions that need answering if you want to get the compensation you deserve. Luckily, our attorneys are no strangers to these kinds of accidents. Well help you gather, and sort through, all the evidence you need to make a successful case and maximize your recovery.Motorcycle AccidentsAccording to the U.S. Department of Transportation motorcyclists are 35 times more likely to experience a deadly accident on the road than those in passenger cars. Due to the weight difference between motorcycles and other vehicles, these accidents almost always result in injuries with extensive medical bills.Boating Accidents2019 was the deadliest year on Alabama waters since 1998, with 25 boating deaths. That number surpasses year-end totals for the last 20 years. Boating accidents are a serious threat to the safety and wellbeing of Alabamas residents, and you need expert legal help to recover what you deserve. The primary cause of boating accidents is operator error.Product LiabilityWhen a product doesnt work the way its meant to, especially if it causes harm to those who put their trust in it, someone needs to be held responsible. Our track record regarding product defect cases has earned our firm the respect of many opposing attorneys and a reputation for providing excellent representation. We have over 30 years of experience as a law firm helping clients receive compensation from some of the most powerful corporations in the country. If you or a loved one have been injured as a result of a defective product contact us.Gun DefectsMost people expect their guns to protect them, or at least to allow them to participate in a hobby they love. When a gun is defective, it can lead to very serious injuries and even death. Gun manufacturers have a responsibility to check each and every brand, make, and model they produce for quality assurance. When they slip up, it has serious consequences. If youve been harmed, or a loved one was killed, by a defective gun, the attorneys at Morris Haynes are ready to fight for you.Slip and Fall AccidentsSlip and fall accidents can result in serious injuries. All property owners are expected to keep their properties clean and safe for the people who use them. When they dont, personal injuries are bound to happen. Whether you or a loved one tripped over something left in a pathway, or slipped on a slick floor with no warning, well fight to get you the compensation you deserve.

Common causes of personal injury lawsuits are: Car AccidentsCar accidents are extremely common, and anything from a fender bender to a serious highway accident can cause personal injury. Even without medical expenses, these kinds of accidents can lead to serious vehicle damage and repair costs. If you were harmed in a car accident due to the negligence of someone else, you deserve to be compensated for your injuries. The attorneys at Morris Haynes have extensive experience in these kinds of cases, and will do whatever we can to help you.Truck AccidentsIts easy for an accident involving an 18-wheeler to get complicatedand fast. When a truck is owned by a company, there are a lot of legal questions that need answering if you want to get the compensation you deserve. Luckily, our attorneys are no strangers to these kinds of accidents. Well help you gather, and sort through, all the evidence you need to make a successful case and maximize your recovery.Motorcycle AccidentsAccording to the U.S. Department of Transportation motorcyclists are 35 times more likely to experience a deadly accident on the road than those in passenger cars. Due to the weight difference between motorcycles and other vehicles, these accidents almost always result in injuries with extensive medical bills.Boating Accidents2019 was the deadliest year on Alabama waters since 1998, with 25 boating deaths. That number surpasses year-end totals for the last 20 years. Boating accidents are a serious threat to the safety and wellbeing of Alabamas residents, and you need expert legal help to recover what you deserve. The primary cause of boating accidents is operator error.Product LiabilityWhen a product doesnt work the way its meant to, especially if it causes harm to those who put their trust in it, someone needs to be held responsible. Our track record regarding product defect cases has earned our firm the respect of many opposing attorneys and a reputation for providing excellent representation. We have over 30 years of experience as a law firm helping clients receive compensation from some of the most powerful corporations in the country. If you or a loved one have been injured as a result of a defective product contact us.Gun DefectsMost people expect their guns to protect them, or at least to allow them to participate in a hobby they love. When a gun is defective, it can lead to very serious injuries and even death. Gun manufacturers have a responsibility to check each and every brand, make, and model they produce for quality assurance. When they slip up, it has serious consequences. If youve been harmed, or a loved one was killed, by a defective gun, the attorneys at Morris Haynes are ready to fight for you.Slip and Fall AccidentsSlip and fall accidents can result in serious injuries. All property owners are expected to keep their properties clean and safe for the people who use them. When they dont, personal injuries are bound to happen. Whether you or a loved one tripped over something left in a pathway, or slipped on a slick floor with no warning, well fight to get you the compensation you deserve.

The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

Taylor & Taylor specializes in trucking litigation, motor vehicle accidents, products liability, insurance bad faith, bank and insurance fraud, wrongful death, personal injury, nursing home abuse and neglect and spinal cord injury cases. The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

Injuries from semi-truck, motorcycle, and car accidents change lives. But at the 40% fee most lawyers charge, it can be difficult to keep up with medical bills or make up for lost wages. Without the attention you need, you may end up shelling out tremendous sums of money to cover medical bills for injuries that weren’t your fault. 
 
At Low Cost Lawyer, many of our clients become friends for life. We invest enormous effort and care in seeking justice for those we represent, forming bonds in the process. Our team of legal professionals and investigators get to work on your case the moment you call—a degree of attention you can’t always count on nationwide or regional firms.

Alabama Personal Injury LawyerOur goal at Morris Haynes is to represent the victims of wrongdoing and injury in their claims against the powerful corporations of the world, with an absolute commitment to the highest principles of professionalism and advocacy. Were dedicated to serving you however we can, and doing whats best for you in your personal injury case.If you or someone you love has been injured as the result of the negligence of someone else, you may be entitled to compensation. Call Morris Haynes. Common causes of personal injury lawsuits are: Car AccidentsCar accidents are extremely common, and anything from a fender bender to a serious highway accident can cause personal injury. Even without medical expenses, these kinds of accidents can lead to serious vehicle damage and repair costs. If you were harmed in a car accident due to the negligence of someone else, you deserve to be compensated for your injuries. The attorneys at Morris Haynes have extensive experience in these kinds of cases, and will do whatever we can to help you.Truck AccidentsIts easy for an accident involving an 18-wheeler to get complicatedand fast. When a truck is owned by a company, there are a lot of legal questions that need answering if you want to get the compensation you deserve. Luckily, our attorneys are no strangers to these kinds of accidents. Well help you gather, and sort through, all the evidence you need to make a successful case and maximize your recovery.Motorcycle AccidentsAccording to the U.S. Department of Transportation motorcyclists are 35 times more likely to experience a deadly accident on the road than those in passenger cars. Due to the weight difference between motorcycles and other vehicles, these accidents almost always result in injuries with extensive medical bills.Boating Accidents2019 was the deadliest year on Alabama waters since 1998, with 25 boating deaths. That number surpasses year-end totals for the last 20 years. Boating accidents are a serious threat to the safety and wellbeing of Alabamas residents, and you need expert legal help to recover what you deserve. The primary cause of boating accidents is operator error.Product LiabilityWhen a product doesnt work the way its meant to, especially if it causes harm to those who put their trust in it, someone needs to be held responsible. Our track record regarding product defect cases has earned our firm the respect of many opposing attorneys and a reputation for providing excellent representation. We have over 30 years of experience as a law firm helping clients receive compensation from some of the most powerful corporations in the country. If you or a loved one have been injured as a result of a defective product contact us.Gun DefectsMost people expect their guns to protect them, or at least to allow them to participate in a hobby they love. When a gun is defective, it can lead to very serious injuries and even death. Gun manufacturers have a responsibility to check each and every brand, make, and model they produce for quality assurance. When they slip up, it has serious consequences. If youve been harmed, or a loved one was killed, by a defective gun, the attorneys at Morris Haynes are ready to fight for you.Slip and Fall AccidentsSlip and fall accidents can result in serious injuries. All property owners are expected to keep their properties clean and safe for the people who use them. When they dont, personal injuries are bound to happen. Whether you or a loved one tripped over something left in a pathway, or slipped on a slick floor with no warning, well fight to get you the compensation you deserve.

Since 2004, we've successfully represented thousands of individuals injured in auto and boating accidents, slip and falls, animal attacks, and more. We also represent individuals harmed by recalled drugs, medical malpractice, negligent security, and nursing home abuse.  Your initial consultation is free. We work on a contingent fee basis, which means that we only get paid if you do! Call today to get the the compensation you deserve.

Mike Slocumb Law Firm is a renowned personal injury law firm, dedicated to helping victims of negligence fight for the justice they deserve. With multiple offices located nationwide, the firm serves individuals and families coast to coast, helping them seek fair compensation after all types of serious accidents and injuries. To date, the team at Mike Slocumb Law Firm has recovered more than $500 million in settlements and verdicts for their clients. As your legal team, Mike Slocumb Law Firm will provide the answers you need to make informed decisions about your case, your recovery, and your future.

Business Name: Quinn, Connor, Weaver, Davies & Rouco LLP
Business Information: Quinn, Connor, Weaver, Davies & Rouco LLP is an established and trusted law firm with offices in Birmingham and the Decatur-Atlanta area. Injuries from semi-truck, motorcycle, and car accidents change lives. But at the 40% fee most lawyers charge, it can be difficult to keep up with medical bills or make up for lost wages. Without the attention you need, you may end up shelling out tremendous sums of money to cover medical bills for injuries that weren’t your fault. 
 
At Low Cost Lawyer, many of our clients become friends for life. We invest enormous effort and care in seeking justice for those we represent, forming bonds in the process. Our team of legal professionals and investigators get to work on your case the moment you call—a degree of attention you can’t always count on nationwide or regional firms.

Alabama Personal Injury LawyerOur goal at Morris Haynes is to represent the victims of wrongdoing and injury in their claims against the powerful corporations of the world, with an absolute commitment to the highest principles of professionalism and advocacy. Were dedicated to serving you however we can, and doing whats best for you in your personal injury case.If you or someone you love has been injured as the result of the negligence of someone else, you may be entitled to compensation. Call Morris Haynes. Common causes of personal injury lawsuits are: Car AccidentsCar accidents are extremely common, and anything from a fender bender to a serious highway accident can cause personal injury. Even without medical expenses, these kinds of accidents can lead to serious vehicle damage and repair costs. If you were harmed in a car accident due to the negligence of someone else, you deserve to be compensated for your injuries. The attorneys at Morris Haynes have extensive experience in these kinds of cases, and will do whatever we can to help you.Truck AccidentsIts easy for an accident involving an 18-wheeler to get complicatedand fast. When a truck is owned by a company, there are a lot of legal questions that need answering if you want to get the compensation you deserve. Luckily, our attorneys are no strangers to these kinds of accidents. Well help you gather, and sort through, all the evidence you need to make a successful case and maximize your recovery.Motorcycle AccidentsAccording to the U.S. Department of Transportation motorcyclists are 35 times more likely to experience a deadly accident on the road than those in passenger cars. Due to the weight difference between motorcycles and other vehicles, these accidents almost always result in injuries with extensive medical bills.Boating Accidents2019 was the deadliest year on Alabama waters since 1998, with 25 boating deaths. That number surpasses year-end totals for the last 20 years. Boating accidents are a serious threat to the safety and wellbeing of Alabamas residents, and you need expert legal help to recover what you deserve. The primary cause of boating accidents is operator error.Product LiabilityWhen a product doesnt work the way its meant to, especially if it causes harm to those who put their trust in it, someone needs to be held responsible. Our track record regarding product defect cases has earned our firm the respect of many opposing attorneys and a reputation for providing excellent representation. We have over 30 years of experience as a law firm helping clients receive compensation from some of the most powerful corporations in the country. If you or a loved one have been injured as a result of a defective product contact us.Gun DefectsMost people expect their guns to protect them, or at least to allow them to participate in a hobby they love. When a gun is defective, it can lead to very serious injuries and even death. Gun manufacturers have a responsibility to check each and every brand, make, and model they produce for quality assurance. When they slip up, it has serious consequences. If youve been harmed, or a loved one was killed, by a defective gun, the attorneys at Morris Haynes are ready to fight for you.Slip and Fall AccidentsSlip and fall accidents can result in serious injuries. All property owners are expected to keep their properties clean and safe for the people who use them. When they dont, personal injuries are bound to happen. Whether you or a loved one tripped over something left in a pathway, or slipped on a slick floor with no warning, well fight to get you the compensation you deserve.

Matt Abbott with the Abbott Law Firm proudly represents the legal needs of those with with personal injury and wrongful death claims. At Simms & Associates, we have defended those accused of a crime and advocated for those who have suffered a personal injury or wrongful death of a loved one. In all of our cases, we provide attentive service to our clients and allow them to benefit from our experience. Legal experience is matched by a unique background in the auto insurance industry. Point-of-view has benefited many clients in the past and can benefit you. Criminal charges can impact every aspect of your life. Your right to drive a vehicle, where and with whom you may live, the cost of insurance, and of course your freedom, can be affected by a criminal conviction. A severe and preventable injury can cause physical and emotional pain that prevents you from enjoying life and working as you did before the accident. 
 
At the law firm of Simms & Associates in Birmingham, we understand that you need diligent and experienced representation from an experienced trial attorney to ensure that your rights are protected. We believe you deserve the best possible outcome, and we dedicate all of our resources to that important goal.

Almost fifty years ago, when specialization was not the trend, Ted Taylor dedicated his practice to relentlessly pursuing a brighter horizon for those individuals and businesses who have been wronged and whose fortunes and future seem bleak. Taylor & Taylor continues its singular focus on representing plaintiffs in cases throughout the southeastern United States.  The firm approaches each case to obtain the greatest result for each client in an aggressive and expeditious manner.  Taylor & Taylor has a winning history of trying lawsuits and recovering for clients in all types of litigation. A full service plaintiff’s trial and appellate practice law firm, Taylor & Taylor is prepared to carry each case from the point of incident to conclusion, through the entire appeals process when necessary. The firm’s practice extends to all corners of the state and beyond, and its lawyers have superior trial experience at all court levels.  Taylor & Taylor specializes in trucking litigation, motor vehicle accidents, products liability, insurance bad faith, bank and insurance fraud, wrongful death, personal injury, nursing home abuse and neglect and spinal cord injury cases. Whether settling out of court, trying cases before juries or handling appeals at the highest level, Taylor & Taylor is equipped to manage your case at every stage of the litigation process. Clients benefit from the firm's responsiveness, personal focus, and award-winning attorneys.

We're proud of what we do to earn justice for our clients every single day—combining expertise, experience, and the willingness to fight for what's right. 
 
Find out more about DLG For Me today.

The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

Injuries from semi-truck, motorcycle, and car accidents change lives. But at the 40% fee most lawyers charge, it can be difficult to keep up with medical bills or make up for lost wages. Without the attention you need, you may end up shelling out tremendous sums of money to cover medical bills for injuries that weren’t your fault. 
 
At Low Cost Lawyer, many of our clients become friends for life. We invest enormous effort and care in seeking justice for those we represent, forming bonds in the process. Our team of legal professionals and investigators get to work on your case the moment you call—a degree of attention you can’t always count on nationwide or regional firms.
